item.title: Lobsters Top Stories: Wednesday, November 13, 2024 at 5:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Jujutsu: A Haven for Mercurial Users at Mozilla (43 points | 7 comments)

3. Jepsen: Bufstream 0.1.0 (41 points | 1 comment)

6. Go Turns 15 (16 points | no comments)
7. Flaunting the Internet Protocols with Tunnels (2 points | 2 comments)
8. Rust needs an official specification (22 points | 42 comments)
9. Announcing .NET 9 (16 points | 3 comments)
10. 3rd edition of Ross Anderson’s Security Engineering book now freely available for download (13 points | 3 comments)
11. fmt.Sprintf vs String Concat (14 points | no comments)
12. What does f(x) mean in C++? (8 points | no comments)
13. Adopting Bazel for Web at Scale (6 points | 3 comments)
14. Using portable SIMD in stable Rust (9 points | no comments)
15. Hyperlight - Running functions in virtual machines (5 points | 3 comments)
16. Playing Bad Apple over RSS (10 points | no comments)
17. Qwen2.5-Coder-32B is an LLM that can code well that runs on my Mac (2 points | no comments)
18. Typed ENV Vars for Valid Environments from Dev to Production (6 points | no comments)

21. VMware Fusion and Workstation now free for all users (28 points | 15 comments)
22. There is no road from here to there (10 points | 15 comments)
23. The CVM Algorithm (38 points | no comments)
24. Dijkstra’s Rallying Cry for Generalization: The Advent of the Recursive Procedure, late 1950s — early 1960s (1 points | no comments)
25. How I ship projects at big tech companies (8 points | 4 comments)
